Introduction.Paragraph: This document details the procedure for performing a pre-flight check on a bicycle, ensuring its safe and reliable operation.

Step.title: Step 1: Brake Inspection
Step.Instruction: 2. Examine the condition and thickness of the brake pads.
Step.Detail: Verify the pads are not overly hardened.
Step.Instruction: 3. Clean any unwanted material from the brake surfaces.

Step.title: Step 2: Brake Installation Check
Step.Instruction: 1. Check the hydraulic brake system function (refer to multimedia object: Hydraulic brake function - infoEntityIdent: ICN-C0419-S1000D0384-001-01).
2. Ensure sufficient clearance exists between the brake pads and the inner diameter of the brake surface.
Step.Caution: If the pads are too low on the rim (as shown in Figure 1 - ICN-C0419-S1000D0382-001-01), they may cause spoke separation. Ensure pads are correctly installed in the center.

Step.title: Step 3: Tire Pressure Check
Step.Instruction: 1. Check the tire pressure using the tire pressure gauge.
2. Compare the reading to the recommended pressure indicated on the tire sidewall.

Step.title: Step 4: Wheel Inspection
Step.Instruction: 1. Examine the rims for bulges and dents.
2. Inspect for splits at the seam of extruded rims.

Step.title: Step 5: Headset Bearing Check
Step.Instruction: 4. Verify the headset bearings are tight.

Step.title: Step 6: Chain Check
Step.Detail: If dirty, clean the chain (refer to document: DA4, 1, 0, 0, 0, B).
Step.Instruction: 2. Visually inspect for frozen or stiff chain links.
Step.Detail: Move the chain onto the largest chain ring.
Pull the chain away from the front of the chain ring.
Ensure the play is minimal (less than a full tooth).
Tighten the chain using the specialist toolset.
